channel.title: So many new comers
channel.description:
So, there are so many new comers. They want to learn to code, make money, and earn rep. Thing is, some don't. They want to leach, make money, and earn rep. I don't thing anyone like us, as in people who've really worked hard on something to simply give it away. I suggest we keep it for a long period of time to see if these new comers would release something of worth.
Just a simple test.
- Move to general discussion please!

item.title: So many new comers
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“baddy351, post:18, topic:409937”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=511211.msg3710187#msg3710187 date=1313292347]

I HAVE A GREAT FUCKING IDEA! CREATE TOPICS LIKE THE ONES I HAVE - EDUCATIONAL AND EXPLANATORY, BUT NOT SPOON-FED!

you’re topics suck, shut up noob.

gO suck A cok Nigger
[/quote]

Oh my, i would get slapped for saying that xD. Seriously though, be nice to people, not just you t4_ But also other people. Alot of people seem to be getting more irratable in this community.[/quote]

Implying we’re serious.

Read full topic

item.title: So many new comers
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“TheCyberMan, post:13, topic:409937”][quote author=`Alec link=topic=511211.msg3709772#msg3709772 date=1313276065]

Those who want to learn to code will learn to code. Those that want to leech will be banned.

I didn’t know ‘leeching’ was a bannable offense.
[/quote]When you repost some else’s work then yes it is.[/quote]
Then don’t release your work if you don’t want people ‘leeching’ it. When you release something fully open source and you don’t want people to just ‘leech’ it then add some difficult errors within the code to make it harder for them to use it.

Read full topic

item.title: So many new comers
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Encryption, post:3, topic:409937”][quote author=_s link=topic=511211.msg3709567#msg3709567 date=1313264530]
yay, lets destroy the concept of open source simply because some people don’t want to learn!!1 no
[/quote]

There are already enough projects to work these days, they can settle down with one of them and learn something. Instead of us releasing something 10x better so they can leach it.[/quote]So in other words, we should force them to use poor sources and by extension learn poor programming techniques? Sounds pretty counter productive.

Read full topic

item.title: So many new comers
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:

[quote=“Encryption, post:3, topic:409937”][quote author=_s link=topic=511211.msg3709567#msg3709567 date=1313264530]
yay, lets destroy the concept of open source simply because some people don’t want to learn!!1 no
[/quote]

There are already enough projects to work these days, they can settle down with one of them and learn something. Instead of us releasing something 10x better so they can leach it.[/quote]
and because there are already projects to work on, people should just use what there is? plenty of operating systems predate windows, why not just work on and use them instead? oh wait, you don’t understand the concept of improvement…

also, if you haven’t noticed, most things created now are shit; why close the hope that something good will ever come?

Read full topic
